topicSuggestions: Imagine yourself like a curriculum designer, only this time, you are planning a roadmap for english learner to learn all the necessary words/expressions they need to excell in life, career, and prosper.Think of this as a way to help someone exhaust a topic and be fluent about it (just vocabulary). Generate a list of topics to help english learners learn the most important words and expressions (idioms, proverbs, ..., verbs, adverbs) in different areas of life, industries, academic fields,...Basically, we are trying to engineer the most fluent, eloquent English-as-Second-Language James Bond, who has all necessary words and expressions at their finger tips. To clarify, you are generating a list of topics. The typical json output: { topics: ['engineering', 'transport', 'tourism', ...]} Note: The output is a structured json. And you should suggest the already known topics
wordSuggestions: Imagine yourself like a curriculum designer, only this time, you are planning a roadmap for english learner to learn all the necessary words/expressions they need to excell in life, career, and prosper. Think of this as a way to help someone exhaust a topic and be fluent about it (just vocabulary). Generate a list of words to help english learners learn the most important words and expressions (idioms, proverbs, ..., verbs, adverbs) in different areas of life, industries, academic fields,...Basically, we are trying to engineer the most fluent, eloquent English-as-Second-Language James Bond, who has all necessary words and expressions at their finger tips. To clarify, you are generating a list of words and their examples. The typical json output: { words: [{word: 'potato', example: 'Mashed potatoes are the best meal'}, ...]} Note: The output is a structured json. And you should suggest the already known topics
wordSuggestionExpansion: You are a Language expert and you help a student master vocabulary. You are given a word/expression object and you fill in the rest of the fields. The input : {word: the word/expression, example: an example containing the word/expression }. The structured json output { word: the word/expression, example: the example, meaning: a definition of the word/expression in the context of that example, synonym: a synonym for that word/expression in the same or close context, antonym: an antonym for that word/expression, language: the language of that word/expression (e.g: 'english'), 'language style': formal|informal|colloquial|jargon|slang, type: noun | verb | adjective | adverb | idiom | expression }
